message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the composition of the Earth and other planets. The layer being referred to in the question is the crust, which is the outermost layer of the Earth and other planets. The crust is composed primarily of silicate rocks, so option (D) is the correct answer. Option (A) is incorrect because limestone is not the primary component of the Earth's crust. Option (B) is incorrect because the Earth's crust is not made up of thick stone piles. Option (C) is incorrect because clay is not the primary composition of the Earth's crust.
